content: Hey, I got a quick question, we currently try to use the trivia bot, but we dont know how we can add it. Is it already integrated? Do I need to run it with zulip-run-bot or with the botserver? Thanks!
I've not run bots before, but my belief is that https://chat.zulip.org/api/running-bots should get you started.
@Timo W. just to clarify, both zulip-run-bot and the botserver are effective ways to run bots; the botserver is a nicer way to run a bot from a server environment.
Thanks, but I still dont get an idea how to run the bot :D Do I need to download any bot files from github? Place them anywhere?
@Timo W.: Did you read https://chat.zulip.org/api/running-bots ?
Yes I did, but they dont mention how to run a specific bot like one from here https://github.com/zulip/python-zulip-api/tree/main/zulip_bots/zulip_bots/bots/trivia_quiz
@Timo W.: In step 4, <bot-name> is trivia_quiz.
Oh wow thanks, you have an idea how to add custom quiz's?
@Timo W. I imagine you'd replace this function: https://github.com/zulip/python-zulip-api/blob/main/zulip_bots/zulip_bots/bots/trivia_quiz/trivia_quiz.py#L94
Thanks, I started the bot now with bot-name: trivia_quiz, so it pulls it from the official repo. How can I build one myself?
Hey, thanks, but how should I do that? That was my initial question, I dont got the bot files anywhere as it builds it from source when I run the bot run command, thanks.

@Timo W. I think it'll be easier to help if you can explain clearly what you've tried. In general, if you want to modify a bot, you can just modify the code, install the resulting modified package, and then run that.
